description:
When running devstack environment logs for all the processes are redirected to stdout/stderr by default in "screen" session.
Due to recent introduction of NovaColorHandler in nova/log.py - The output is colorized based on the loglevel

The logs shown on console scroll away easily, developers also capture the logs to file - for later perusal - by adding following line to the "nova.conf"

log_dir=/var/log/nova

When the logging to file is enabled *along with log to console* following error is shown on the console after EVERY log statement

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 842, in emit
    msg = self.format(record)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 719, in format
    return fmt.format(record)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/log.py", line 258, in format
    return logging.Formatter.format(self, record)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 467, in format
    s = self._fmt % record.__dict__
KeyError: 'color'

This is because "LegacyNovaFormatter" does not have an attribute "color" - hence the error.
title: logging to file broken

comments.content:
This is problematic because due to the above error, logs are NOT redirected to the logfile

Workaround : remove references to "%(color)s" from nova.conf
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mandarvaze

comments.content:
If you are going to manually edit nova.conf this way, please simply use the provided switch in your devstack localr:

LOG_COLOR=False

It will also turn off color if you use syslog via localrc:

SYSLOG=True
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda
